abstract: The proposed agreement with the United States includes a fine of at least $7 billion to $10 billion and the disclosure of the names of banks’ American clients.
snippet: The proposed agreement with the United States includes a fine of at least $7 billion to $10 billion and the disclosure of the names of banks’ American clients.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss government is considering a proposal to disclose bank client names and pay a multibillion-dollar fine to the United States to help resolve a long-running dispute between the two countries over the handling of tax-evasion cases, American and Swiss sources briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Switzerland Weighs Deal in Tax Cases
headline.print_headline: Switzerland Weighs Deal In Tax Cases
